DOC.brief_title: Peer Mentoring Promoting Follow-up Care Self-Management Younger Childhood Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Adapt problem-solving skill training ( PSST ) peer mentor improve adolescent young adult ( AYA ) self-management long-term follow-up care . II . Evaluate feasibility self-management + peer mentor program pilot randomize control trial ( RCT ) . III . Assess preliminary efficacy peer mentor program vs. widely available print brochure . OUTLINE : PHASE 1 : Participants ( provider , survivor , caregiver ) complete 60 minute interview help adapt PSST focus AYA self-management care . PHASE 2 : Patients randomize 1of 2 arm . ARM I : Patients complete adapt PSST peer mentor intervention comprise videoconference phone call peer mentor follow secure text message weekly 4 week monthly 2 month . ARM II : Patients receive tailor survivorship educational material Children 's Oncology Group patient education `` Health Links '' well brochure self-management strategy entitle : `` Moving Into Adult Health Care : A Guide Young Adults With Without Disabilities '' via email postal mail . Patients also receive general health tip ( e.g. , exercise nutrition recommendation ) via text message weekly 4 week monthly 2 month .
